author: Aaron Gould Sheinin
title: Georgia anti-abortion group names new leader
text:
A top anti-abortion group has a new leader as long-time Georgia Right to Life president Dan Becker prepares to exit.
GRTL on Thursday announced veteran pro-life advocate Ricardo Davis will take over as president Nov. 10. Becker, who has been president since 2007, will move to Personhood Alliance, a separate organization founded in 2014.
Davis owns a healthcare information systems consulting firm and was a campaign consultant to former U.S. Rep. Paul Broun, R-Ga.
012312 Atlanta, Ga; People hold a sign reading, “Together For Life,” during the Georgia Right to Life rally at the steps of the Georgia State Capitol Monday afternoon in Atlanta, Ga., January 23, 2012. The rally is to commemorate lives lost to abortion since the Roe v Wade decision of 1973, which legalized abortion. Jason Getz jgetz@ajc.com The change in leadership comes after Georgia Right to Life was kicked out of the National Right to Life organization over GRTL’s objection to allowing legal abortions for women who have been raped or were victims of incest.
The national group named Georgia Life Alliance as its Georgia affiliate in March 2014. The Georgia Life Alliance was itself created in 2014 specifically to challenge Georgia Right to Life .
Becker himself has been criticized by Republicans both for his opposition to exceptions and his methods. He publicly picked a fight with House Speaker David Ralston, R-Blue Ridge, and called former Secretary of State Karen Handel “barren” during Handel’s bid for the GOP nomination as governor in 2010.
